meanings.sent1: The pops of the fireworks filled the night sky.
meanings.sent2: I heard pops coming from the kitchen as the popcorn was being made.
meanings.sent3: The pops of the balloons scared the cat, making it jump.
meanings.sent4: The pops of the bubble wrap echoed through the empty room.
meanings.sent5: The pops of the firecrackers made everyone cover their ears.

meanings.definition: A term of endearment for one's father.
meanings.sent1: My pops always tells the best bedtime stories.
meanings.sent2: I love spending time fishing with my pops on weekends.
meanings.sent3: My pops is the best at making pancakes on Saturday mornings.
meanings.sent4: Even though my pops is strict, he always has a kind smile.
meanings.sent5: I look up to my pops for his wisdom and guidance.

meanings.definition: To make a short, sharp sound.
meanings.sent1: The toy gun pops when you pull the trigger.
meanings.sent2: The popcorn pops loudly in the microwave.
meanings.sent3: The cork pops out of the champagne bottle with a loud 'pop'.
meanings.sent4: The fire crackles and pops in the fireplace on a cold night.
meanings.sent5: The bubble wrap pops when you press on it with your fingers.

meanings.sent1: The squirrel pops up from behind the tree and scurries away.
meanings.sent2: The rabbit pops out of its burrow and dashes across the field.
meanings.sent3: The cat pops out of the box, surprising everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The jack-in-the-box pops up when you turn the handle.
meanings.sent5: The toast pops out of the toaster when it's done.

meanings.sent1: I grabbed a cold pops from the fridge to quench my thirst.
meanings.sent2: The kids enjoyed sipping on their favorite pops during the picnic.
meanings.sent3: The pops fizzed and bubbled when I opened the can.
meanings.sent4: A refreshing pops is perfect on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent5: The pops was so fizzy that it tickled my nose when I drank it.
